title: Generate front page items from most recently changed pages
description:
The front page currently has hardcoded links. Instead, it should dynamically show the 3 most recently changed wiki pages. This will make the front page more useful by surfacing recently updated content.

## Technical approach

Query the D1 database using the existing pattern:

```typescript
const recentPages = await env.DB
  .prepare('SELECT name FROM pages ORDER BY updated_at DESC LIMIT 3')
  .all<{ name: string }>();
```

The `pages` table has an `updated_at` column (Unix timestamp) that gets set during vault sync.

title: Add 'Verenthal' to front page of app
Add global search with command palette
description:
## Overview
Add a global search feature accessible via a command palette (Cmd/Ctrl+K) that searches wiki pages by title.

## Requirements
- Command palette UI triggered by keyboard shortcut (Cmd+K / Ctrl+K)
- Search pages by title (server-side query)
- Display matching results as user types
- Navigate to selected page on enter/click

## Simple Implementation Approach
1. **UI Component**: Use a modal/dialog with an input field. Consider cmdk (https://cmdk.paco.me/) or build a simple custom one with a dialog + input + results list.

2. **Server Function**: Create a `createServerFn` that queries the D1 database:
   ```sql
   SELECT slug, title FROM pages 
   WHERE title LIKE '%' || ? || '%' 
   ORDER BY title LIMIT 10
   ```

3. **Keyboard Listener**: Add a global keydown listener in the root layout that opens the palette on Cmd/Ctrl+K.

4. **Debounce**: Debounce the search input (300ms) to avoid excessive queries.

## Future Enhancements (out of scope)
- Full-text search on content
- Fuzzy matching
- Recent pages / frecency
- Client-side caching

title: Add keyboard navigation to global search
description:
Add full keyboard navigation support to the command palette / global search:

- Arrow keys (up/down) to navigate through results
- Vim-style navigation with j/k keys
- Enter to select the highlighted result
- Tab to cycle through the list

This makes the search more accessible and faster to use without a mouse.
